description.raw:
depends on [ign-common pull request #227](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-common/pull-requests/227/add-pbr-material-class/diff)

Ogre2’s PBR material has a high default metalness value \(metalness = 0.8\) which causes objects to appear dark \(when compared to ogre 1.x\). This PR updates the mesh loader to use the default PBR material default values from ign-common \(metalness = 0.5\) when loading meshes and their materials.

To test with the `ogre2_demo`, you can comment out [this line ](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/src/ee3bdc5fbe6ece157ae73fc03af2ce9deade2079/examples/ogre2_demo/Main.cc#lines-111)to let the duck mesh use it’s own default material from ign-common.  Here’s a comparison with and without the changes in this PR \(both with the [line](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/src/ee3bdc5fbe6ece157ae73fc03af2ce9deade2079/examples/ogre2_demo/Main.cc#lines-111) commented out\)

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/zq9ear/images/1696378137-common_pbr_material.png)
‌
description.html:
depends on ign-common pull request #227

Ogre2’s PBR material has a high default metalness value (metalness = 0.8) which causes objects to appear dark (when compared to ogre 1.x). This PR updates the mesh loader to use the default PBR material default values from ign-common (metalness = 0.5) when loading meshes and their materials.

To test with the ogre2_demo, you can comment out this line to let the duck mesh use it’s own default material from ign-common. Here’s a comparison with and without the changes in this PR (both with the line commented out)

‌

title.raw: Use default material properties from ign-common PBR material when loading a mesh
